com.bluegosling.streams

Interface StreamOperator<T,U>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element produced by the operation
    U - the type of upstream element consumed by the operation
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface StreamOperator<T,U>
extends AutoCloseable
    A stream operator provides a simple intermediate operation, or stage, in a stream. These are non-terminal operations that accept data produced by the upstream operation, perform some sort of transformation on the data, and then send the results to downstream operations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void close()
      Performs clean-up needed after processing of the stream completes.
      StreamNode<T,U> createNode()
      Constructs a node that will process data in the stream.
      default int spliteratorCharacteristics(int upstreamCharacteristics)
      Adjusts the input characteristics, returning the output characteristics.
      default long spliteratorEstimatedSize(long upstreamEstimatedSize)
      Adjusts the estimated size of the data source.
      default void startStream()
      Performs initialization needed prior to processing the stream.

    • Method Detail

      • startStream

        default void startStream()
        Performs initialization needed prior to processing the stream. The default implementation does nothing.

      • close

        default void close()
            throws Exception
        Performs clean-up needed after processing of the stream completes. The default implementation does nothing.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Exception

      • spliteratorCharacteristics

        default int spliteratorCharacteristics(int upstreamCharacteristics)
        Adjusts the input characteristics, returning the output characteristics. The given value represents the characteristics of the upstream stage of the stream. If this operator modifies the stream in a way that alters the characteristics it emits to downstream stages, it should return an adjusted set of characteristics.

        The default implementation returns the given characteristics unchanged.

        Parameters:
        upstreamCharacteristics - the characteristics of the upstream stage
        Returns:
        the characteristics of the data that this stage provides

      • spliteratorEstimatedSize

        default long spliteratorEstimatedSize(long upstreamEstimatedSize)
        Adjusts the estimated size of the data source. The given value represents the estimated size of the data source provided by the upstream stage. If this operator changes the number of elements emitted to downstream stages, it can adjust the size estimate via this method.

        The default implementation returns the given estimate unchanged.

        Parameters:
        upstreamEstimatedSize - the estimated size of the upstream stage
        Returns:
        the estimated size of the data that this stage provides

      • createNode

        StreamNode<T,U> createNode()
        Constructs a node that will process data in the stream. For a sequential stream, this will be invoked once to produce a single processing node. For a parallel stream, this will be invoked once per thread that processes the stream, each node being a single-threaded component of processing.
        Returns:
        a node that will process data in the stream
